title: 113_hr3733
content: The Act may be cited as the "Trade and Environment Enforcement Act" or "Green 301 Act". It focuses on environmental protection in trade relations. Section 301(d)(3)(B) of the Trade Act of 1974 is amended to include a new clause addressing a persistent pattern of conduct related to environmental laws in foreign countries. The Trade Act of 1974 is amended to address violations of environmental laws in foreign countries by providing access to remedies and enforcing environmental commitments in agreements. The Trade Act of 1974 is amended to identify foreign country trade practices that negatively affect the environment. The Trade Representative will identify foreign country trade practices that have negative environmental impacts on human, animal, or plant life, or the conservation of natural resources. Factors considered include the connection between trade and environmental impact, as well as the significance of the impact on life and resources. The Trade Representative will identify foreign country trade practices with negative environmental impacts and consult with interested parties. Reports on this issue will be submitted every 2 years. The Trade Representative will submit reports every 2 years to the Committee on Ways and Means and the Committee on Finance, identifying foreign country trade practices that negatively affect the environment. The report may also include descriptions of other trade practices that could be included in the future. The Trade Representative will submit reports every 2 years to identify foreign country trade practices that negatively affect the environment, including those not covered by existing trade agreements. Progress is being made to address these negative impacts.
